title: A woman was on ‘Naked and Afraid.’ Her boss allegedly accessed her uncensored photos.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News In a new lawsuit, Danielle Beauchemin also accuses her former supervisor of hiding cameras in the ceiling above her office to spy on her.
The Yasuni National Park in Ecuador's northeastern jungle.
Ecuador is one of the countries where Maine resident Danielle Beauchemin competed on the reality TV show “Naked and Afraid.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.

bullets: Do you stay in the loop with the local news?

com news quiz to test your knowledge and stay informed on the latest trending stories in Greater Boston.

title: Hundreds march in Boston after ICE agent fatally shoots woman in Minneapolis
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “The violence we are seeing did not begin on January 7.
The only difference now is that more people are finally seeing it.
” Activists march in downtown Boston Thursday night to protest the fatal shooting of Renee Good by an ICE agent.

title: Mass. man pleads guilty to wildlife trafficking
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News The man consented to the civil forfeiture of more than 100 wildlife parts including orangutan and tiger skulls and jaguar skin, according to the U.
S.
Attorney for Massachusetts.

title: Juvenile dies after suffering cardiac arrest at Boston community center, police say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News On Wednesday at 6:24 p.
m.
, an officer responded to a call of an unconscious person at Roxbury Tenants of Harvard on Vining Street, according to a police report.

title: Man fatally shot, police sergeant injured during standoff in Mass. town
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News Shots were fired as police attempted to conduct a wellness check on a man who had made a call to the FBI that “sparked mental health concerns,” officials said.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A man died and two police officers were shot in Hinsdale after a standoff Wednesday prompted by concerns about the man’s mental health, officials said.

title: Brown University launches new campus recovery effort in wake of fatal shooting
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News “The Brown community is resilient, caring, and strong.
We are ever true.

” A couple embrace at a makeshift memorial outside the Barus & Holley Engineering and Physics Building at Brown University, where two people were killed and nine people were injured by a gunman, in Providence, RI on December 19, 2025.

title: Boston nightclub where woman suffered medical emergency and died has license reinstated
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News After hearing testimony from club representatives and the loved ones of a woman who died there Dec.
21, regulators found no violations.
ICON, a nightclub in Boston's Theater District, had its entertainment license reinstated at a hearing Thursday.

title: Springfield agrees to pay over $14 million in child sex abuse settlement after teacher accused of rape
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News One lawsuit was settled for $1.
8 million and the other for $13 million, the largest reported child sex abuse settlement in state history, lawyers said.

title: Healey directly calls on 2 airlines to end ICE collaboration
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Gov.
Maura Healey's demands come after ICE expanded its operations at Hanscom Field in Bedford last year.
